subject: Art & Design
title: The Role of Sound Design in Film
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Role of Sound Design in Film.

hook.text: In Saving Private Ryan's beach scene, the sound cuts to muffled ringing. You experience the soldier's shell shock.

buildup.text: Sound design includes dialogue, ambient noise, foley effects, and silence. Each is a storytelling tool.

discovery.text: Foley artists recreate sounds manually: footsteps on gravel, doors creaking, clothes rustling. All performed live.

twist.text: Strategic silence is the most powerful sound effect. Remove all sound, and the audience leans in with tension.

climax.text: Ben Burtt created the Star Wars lightsaber hum from a TV set and a film projector motor. Pure creativity.

punchline.text: You watch a film with your eyes. You feel it with your ears.

quiz.question: What is foley in sound design?
options: Manually recreating everyday sounds (footsteps, doors) for film
